forumNotes.author: breaker
forumNotes.content:
> hi all there   
> all i wants to learn diff methods to boot system

grub4dos, syslinux with memdisk, and grub2 can all do it, but they all have their strengths... yes, read my friend, have fun!  

grub2 can also use memdisk to boot floppy images, etc, without using memdisk, you can use grub2 to boot certain Linux LiveCD isos..... :  
[http://www.panticz.de/MultiBootUSB](http://www.panticz.de/MultiBootUSB "External link") is an example... this does not require contiguous iso files, but grub4dos does...  

Basically, pick which MBR code you want to use (syslinux, grub4dos, grub2, whatever) then find the instructions about how to install to the usb stick, then find the examples for the menu entries. Try, learn, have fun!

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
see my post here [http://www.boot-land...?...ic=7916\&hl=](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=7916&hl= "External link") for booting WinPE v2/Vista/Win7 ISOs.  

This may help you get an idea. Actually, with new RMPrepUSB v2.0.734 it is even simpler.  

Create a bootable USB drive as USB HDD and click the Install Grub Bootloader button. Now just add your iso's and the menu.lst.  

You can download the MS WAIK to make WinPE.  

Let us know what you want to boot and have a go!  

A lot depends on the BIOS in your system - if it doesn't work on one system, try another - it may work on that!
